alert.note: Alert for Marion (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 03 at 4:39PM EDT by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern Marion and central Morrow Counties through 515 PM EDT... At 438 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Waldo, or 9 miles southeast of Marion, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Mount Gilead, Cardington, Waldo, Caledonia, Edison, Fulton and State Route 229 at US Route 23. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for north central Ohio.
